text:
187 to 176 South Street, north side, west from and including James Slip, to and including Roosevelt Street. The houses shown beyond Roosevelt Street, (and appear as if directly under the Brooklyn Bridge) are facing on Front Street, as South Street at this point, makes a sharp bend southward. Also shown (right foreground), are Nos. 19 to 11 1/2 James Slip, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of South Street. Note the James Slip Gospel Mission occupying the corner house (bearing Nos. 187 South Street and No. 19 James Slip), and the adjoining building.
June 22, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

The same, from (No. 186) a point slightly southward, and viewed in a more southerly direction. The 4-story house (extreme left) shown, is No. 133 Roosevelt Street, at the S.W. corner of Front Street. This area is known to be the center of the waste paper trade of New York.
September 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

A detail showing only Nos. 182-3-4-5 South Street; the two latter numbers being the 5-story structures on the right.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - James Slip

title: Manhattan: South Street - James Slip

text:
(1)

James Slip (right), west side, north from and including South, to but not including Cherry Streets, after crossing Water Street, showing the James Slip Mission at the N.W. corner of South Street. Also shown are 187 to 185 South Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W.
corner of James Slip.

September 7, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, at a later date, showing a limited view on James Slip
(Nos. 19 to 15) and an extended view on South Street.
January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Manhattan: James Slip - South Street

title: Manhattan: James Slip - South Street

text:
South Street, at the N. W. corner of James Slip, showing a building occupied by the James Slip Gospel Mission. This is No. 187 South Street.

October 1927

George L. Balgue, photo
title: Manhattan: South Street - James Slip
